title: The Project
content: [Slack](https://slack.com/) is a communication platform with a mission to make work more simple, pleasant, and productive.
The pandemic of 2020 introduced a new meaning to the hybrid-remote workplace. Empowering teams to build human connections in this era, we decided to add video to the voice-only mobile Slack calls.

caption: Solution
title: The Product
content: Slack mobile video calls [launched](https://slack.com/blog/productivity/whats-new-mobile-video-calls-slack-connect-direct-messages) in January 2021.
Holding close a Slack product principle to not reinvent the wheel, I designed Slack mobile video calls to be familiar and intuitive, while also embracing the quirky Slack product brand.

caption: Together While Apart
title: Video Streams
content: We display up to 6 concurrent video streams, the maximum number of videos that comfortably fit on a phone screen. Basic information, like a person's name and call status, is visible by default for professional context.
imgCaption: Video stream layouts for up to 6 people

caption: Don't Make Me Think
title: Interaction Design
content: A dismissable drawer, that's kept out of the way until summoned with a tap or swipe up, houses all call options in a central, easy to find place. New active and inactive button states also let users tell if they are muted or not.
imgCaption: Accessing call options from the bottom drawer

caption: Keep Slack Weird
title: Product Branding
content: Bringing some whimsy while waiting for someone to pick up a call, I partnered with our Content and Creative teams to introduce Slack branded background animation and copy.
imgCaption: Outgoing call animation and randomized call copy

caption: Value Sameness
title: Accessibility
content: So that as many people as possible could have experiences of similar value, we supported an efficient way for mobile screenreader users to interact with Slack calls.

caption: Product in the Wild
title: Release & Next Steps
content: Mobile video calls rolled out smoothly. In addition to filling gaps, the feature also won us a few enterprise sales.
Slack continues to invest in A/V features, like Huddles.
